title: Lush's 2024 Halloween Collection Is Scary Good
description: Lush's new Halloween collection is almost here, and it's loaded with limited-edition, festive bath and body-care items. From pumpkin-shaped bath bombs and seasonally appropriate scented masks to "shower slime" that, despite the name, will make you feel extra luxurious, these Halloween treats will make you want to hit that "Add to Cart" button stat. If you're at all familiar with Lush's past Halloween drops, then you know this new one is bound to be a hit. There are over 24 items in total, including Lush's first-ever Halloween Countdown gift box. This means not only will the items in the Halloween line transform your bathroom into a mystical location, but they're also perfect for any upcoming Virgo or Scorpio birthdays you have on your calendar. For the 2024 Lush Halloween collection, a few mystical favorites are returning, like the Lord of Misrule Shower Gel (a bestseller from last year), and the Ghostie Bath Bomb. However, there are also a bunch of new wicked launches to experience. This includes a Hocus Pocus Soakus bubble bar, a Witches Cat sheet mask made with fresh pumpkin puree, and a fun Ghost In The Dark shower gel. The Lush Halloween collection is available in stores and online now, so keep scrolling to start shopping.
author: Jessica Harrington
excerpt: Shop the 2024 Lush Halloween collection featuring shower slime, pumpkin face masks, Scream bath bombs, and more.

Lush's new Halloween collection is almost here, and it's loaded with limited-edition, festive bath and body-care items. From pumpkin-shaped bath bombs and seasonally appropriate scented masks to "shower slime" that, despite the name, will make you feel extra luxurious, these Halloween treats will make you want to hit that "Add to Cart" button stat.

If you're at all familiar with Lush's past Halloween drops, then you know this new one is bound to be a hit. There are over 24 items in total, including Lush's first-ever Halloween Countdown gift box. This means not only will the items in the Halloween line transform your bathroom into a mystical location, but they're also perfect for any upcoming Virgo or Scorpio birthdays you have on your calendar.

For the 2024 Lush Halloween collection, a few mystical favorites are returning, like the Lord of Misrule Shower Gel (a bestseller from last year), and the Ghostie Bath Bomb. However, there are also a bunch of new wicked launches to experience. This includes a Hocus Pocus Soakus bubble bar, a Witches Cat sheet mask made with fresh pumpkin puree, and a fun Ghost In The Dark shower gel.

The Lush Halloween collection is available in stores and online now, so keep scrolling to start shopping.

Witches Cat Sheet Mask

Witches Cat Sheet Mask ($11)

Lush's Witches Cat Sheet Mask is made with carrageenan extract to hydrate and soften skin. Sandalwood oil gives it a calming scent that will have you chilling out on your couch without a care in the world.

Boo-tiful Under Eye Pads

Boo-tiful Under Eye Pads ($7)

Don't wanna scare anyone away with your dark circles? Try these under eye patches, which were inspired by the opening credits of "The Nightmare Before Christmas" movie.

Brain Freeze Bath Bomb

Brain Freeze Bath Bomb ($8)

Made with refreshing peppermint oil and spearmint, this bath bomb will wake up your senses. Even better? It's made with crackling popping candy so you can have a multisensory experience.

Batcurrant Lip Scrub

Batcurrant Lip Scrub ($14)

This fruity lip scrub tastes like a berry soda, and is made with blackcurrant to heal the skin, fair trade shea butter to moisturize, and white caster sugar to exfoliate.

Blood Orange Lip Scrub

Blood Orange Lip Scrub ($14)

This exfoliating lip scrub is made with caster sugar to help eliminate dryness on the lips, while jojoba oil will moisturize and soften. It's made with a tangy blood orange oil scent.

Magic Potion Bath Bomb

Magic Potion Bath Bomb ($9)

It's not just a witchy package; this bath bomb is truly magical with its floral scent and fun, metallic-pink hue.

Monster Octopus Shower Jelly

Monster Octopus Shower Jelly ($15)

Love monsters? This shower jelly is for you. Besides its octopus shape, it also has a delicious passion fruit fragrance with notes of vanilla and blackcurrant.

Ghost in the Dark Soap

Ghost in the Dark Soap ($10, out of stock online; check stores for availability)

Another glow-in-the-dark favorite, this soap smells like cocoa butter and lemongrass.

Bubble Lugosi Bubble Bar

Bubble Lugosi Bubble Bar ($11)

Dracula costume, be damned. This bar glows in the dark to ensure an extra wicked bath and has a blackberry scent to boot.

Alien Bubble Bar

Alien Bubble Bar ($10)

An alien that smells of a blend of corn starch, bergamot, and litsea cubeba oils sounds like a good deal.

Ghostie Bath Bomb

Ghostie Bath Bomb ($8)

Shades of pink, blue, and white are left behind as this bath bomb dissolves. It also fills the room with candy and zesty lemongrass scents.

Bat Art Bath Bomb

Bat Art Bath Bomb ($8)

Smells like a witch's brew with the notes of herbal lemon, rosemary, and sage that this bath bomb will add to you bath. It also turns your bathtub black, blue, and purple.

Mr. Pumpkin Face Fresh Face Mask

Mr. Pumpkin Face Fresh Face Mask ($14, out of stock online; check stores for availability)

The ground pumpkin seeds and pumpkin pur√©e in this mask will give you its vitamin-packed benefits.

Jessica Harrington is the senior beauty editor at PS, where she writes about hair, makeup, skin care, piercings, tattoos, and more. As a New York City-based writer and editor with a degree in journalism and over eight years of industry experience, she loves to interview industry experts, keep up with the latest trends, and test new products.

Renee Rodriguez is a staff writer and social producer for PS. She writes across all verticals, but her main areas of expertise focus on fashion and beauty content with an emphasis on reviews and editor experiments. She also produces social content for the PS TikTok and Instagram accounts.
